title: Rava Dosa
content: Ingredients: Wheat Flour - 1 cup Rice Flour - 1 cup Semolina - 1/2 cup ( Sooji/ Mumbai Rava ) Oil - As required to apply on dosa Salt - As per taste Procedure: -- Take a bowl then add wheat flour, rice flour, semolina and salt in it -- Mix it properly by adding water with out any lumps in the batter -- Batter should be in pouring consistency -- Dosa Tawa should be in medium heat -- Once check the tawa is heat or not by sprinkling water on it -- Now add batter in dosa Tawa -- Apply oil -- Heat both sides till golden brown color -- Serve with coconut chutney Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney

title: Vermicelli Kheer/ Semiya Payasam
content: Ingredients: Vermicelli - 1 cup Milk - 5 cups Sugar - 3/4th cup Ghee - 3 tb sp Almond Flakes - 2 tb sp Procedure: -- Take a pan add one tb sp of ghee fry vermicelli with low heat till golden brown color and then take out vermicelli in a bowl -- Now add almond flakes in the same pan fry till golden brown color and then take out in a bowl -- Next add fried vermicelli in the pan and add Milk in it with low to medium heat , stir the content in between so that it won't sticky to the pan -- When milk boils at that time add sugar and 2 tb sp of ghee -- Stir the content until it becomes like kheer consistency -- At that moment switch off the Burner and add fried almond flakes -- Serve it in a bowl

title: Spicy Roasted chickpea Powder / Pappula podi / Bhuna Chana powder
content: Ingredients: Roasted chickpea/ Pappulu - 1 cup Dry red chillies - 4 (or) Red chilli powder - 1 tb sp Dry coconut powder - 2 Tb sp Garlic - 3 cloves Salt - As per taste Procedure: -- Add all the ingredients in mixer grinder until it becomes smooth powder -- Serve it with Rice and pickle/dosa/idly

title: Vegetable Poha/ Pressed Rice/ Attukulu
content:
Ingredients: Pressed rice/ Poha / Attukulu - 2 cups Carrot chopped - 1 cup Beans chopped - 1 cup Onion chopped - 1 cup Tomatoes chopped - 1 cup Tamarind paste - 1 tb sp Turmeric - 1/2 tb sp Fresh grated coconut - 2 tb sp Mustard seeds - 1/4 tb sp Jeera / Cumin seeds - 1/4 tb sp Urad dal - 1/2 tb sp Bengal gram - 1/2 tb sp Curry leaves - 6 Green chillies - 6 Roasted ground nuts - 1 tb sp Coriander chopped - 1 cup Oil - 2 tb sp Salt - As per taste Procedure:
  • Add Poha in a bowl wash with water and sprinkle little amount of water drain water after 5 mins ( check the pressed rice is easy to break or not ). Keep it aside
  • In mixer grinder add salt, green chillies and grated coconut. Keep this paste aside
  • Take a Frying pan add oil let it heat for one minute
  • Now add Mustard seeds, Jeera, Urad dal, Bengal gram saute it then add curry leaves and green chillies
  • Add chopped carrots and beans fry for few seconds and then add onion saute it until the color changes to golden brown
  • Next add chopped tomatoes saute it for one minute after that add turmeric powder
  • Now add coconut paste and saute for few seconds then immediately add tamarind paste.
  • When the oil comes out it is well cooked at this moment add soaked Poha and saute for 3 to 5 minutes
  • Now add Roasted ground nuts and mix well
  • Switch off the burner and add chopped coriander
  • Serve it with Spicy Roasted chickpea powder / Pappula podi
[gallery ids="176,174,171,173,169,167,164,166,168,175,165,170" type="rectangular"] [gallery ids="172,177" type="rectangular"]

title: Stuffed Ridge Gourd/ Oppu Beerakaya Curry
content:
Ingredients: Ridge gourd - 1 Fresh grated coconut - 1 cup Onion - 1 cup (chopped) Dry Red chillies - 4 Red chili powder - 1 Tb sp Coriander seeds - 1 tea spoon Cumin / Jeera - 1 tea spoon Garlic - 3 cloves Tamarind paste - 1 tea spoon Jaggery - one small piece Coriander - 1 cup Salt - As per taste For Tempering/ Tadka/ Popu: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/4 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Oil - 1 tb sp Procedure:
  • Wash Ridge gourd and peel off. Cut Ridge gourd into medium round shape then make cross cut like X on them. Keep them aside
  • Add coconut powder, dry red chillies, red chili powder, jeera, coriander seeds, jaggery, garlic, Salt in mixer grinder until smooth paste. Keep it aside
  • Now add onion in mixer grinder form coarse paste. Take out onion paste
  • Mix coconut paste and onion paste in a bowl
  • Stuff this masala paste in Ridge gourd and arrange in a plate
  • Add Tempering/ Tadka/ popu on top of the Ridge gourd pieces
  • Garnish with coriander and steam for about 15 to 20 mins
  • Serve it with Red gram /dal/ kandi pappu, rice and ghee
[gallery ids="222,225,224,223" type="rectangular"] [gallery ids="280,279" type="rectangular"]

title: Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney
content:
Ingredients: Roasted Chickpea/ Pappulu - 3 Tb sp Fresh grated Coconut - 1 cup Coriander - 1/2 cup Green chillies - 4 Lemon juice - 1 tea spoon Salt - As per taste For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/4 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Oil - 1 tb sp Procedure:
  • Take Roasted chickpea, green chillies, salt, coriander leaves add in mixer grinder blend them to medium coarse paste
  • Add grated coconut in the same jar and make smooth paste
  • Take out the paste in a bowl
  • Add lemon juice and mix well
  • Finally add tempering to coriander coconut chutney
  • Serve it with idly/ dosa/ puri
  • Enjoy it with your favorite type of dosa
  [gallery ids="270,271" type="rectangular"]

title: Instant Idly/ Instant Rava idly/ Instant Sooji idly
content:
Ingredients: Semolina/ Sooji/ Mumbai Rava - 1 cup Yogurt/ Curd/ Perugu- 2 cups Green chillies - 1 sliced Onion chopped - 1 cup Carrot grated - 1/2 cup Coriander chopped - 1/2 cup Baking soda - One pinch Salt - As per taste For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/4 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/4 tea spoon Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Oil -  2 sauce ladle Procedure:
  • Take a frying pan add two sauce ladle oil with medium heat
  • Add tempering and saute well
  • Now add onion chopped saute until the color changes to golden brown
  • Add Semolina/ Sooji/ Mumbai Rava stir it for 2 to 3 minutes in the same pan. Switch off burner
  • Next add grated carrot, coriander chopped and mix it well
  • Take out Semolina to a bowl
  • Add baking soda, salt and required amount of curd the batter should medium thick consistency
*** Don't add water to the idly batter if required add some more curd to the batter to make proper consistency. It's important because if you add water to the batter idly won't come in perfect shape***
  • Add one and half cup of water in idly cooker
  • Keep idly batter in idly stand and steam for 10 to 12 minutes
  • Serve it with fresh coriander coconut chutney Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney
Tip: Serve idly when it is hot [gallery ids="328,329,330,334,335,336,337" type="rectangular"]

title: Healthy Green Sandwich
content:
Ingredients: Wheat bread - 4 slices Cucumber - peel off and sliced Green Bell Pepper/ Capsicum - sliced Baby spinach - 8 to 10 leaves Onion - sliced Ghee - 2 tb sp Pepper powder Avacado Spread: Fully Riped Avacado - 1 Onion - half Green chillies - 2 Coriander Salt - As per taste Lemon juice - 2 tb sp Procedure: Avocado Spread:
  • Cut Avacado 🥑 and take out the seed
  • With a spoon take out avacado pulp and mash it in a bowl
  • Add finely chopped onion, green chillies, coriander, salt and lemon juice
  • Mix it well
[gallery ids="371,370" type="rectangular"] Sandwich:
  • Take two slices of bread 🍞, apply ghee on both sides of the slices and keep in toaster (or) heat on tawa by applying ghee on it
  • Take out the slices when it becomes golden brown color
  • Keep the two slices in a plate and apply avacado Spread on both slices equally
  • Next on one slice of bread arrange sliced cucumber🥒, Onion, Green bell pepper/ capsicum and spinach. Sprinkle pepper powder on it
  • Take another slice and cover it on the other one to make a sandwich
  • Serve it with tomato ketchup
[gallery ids="396,390,391,392" type="square"]

title: Spicy Ginger Chutney/ Allam pachadi
content:
Ingredients: Ginger chopped - 1 tb sp Fresh grated coconut - 4 tb sp Dry red chillies - 2 Red chilli powder - 1 tea spoon Cumin seeds / Jeera - 1 tea spoon Coriander seeds - 1/2 tb sp Tamarind paste - 1/2 tb sp Jaggery powder - 1 tea spoon Coriander - 2 tb sp Salt - As per taste Oil - 1/2 tb sp Procedure:
  • Take a tempering pan
  • Add oil, chopped ginger fry till golden brown color with medium heat and take out in a bowl
  • In the same pan add Cumin seeds/ jeera, coriander and dry red chillies fry till the color changes to brown
  • Now in mixer grinder add fried jeera, coriander, dry red chillies, ginger, salt and jaggery powder make smooth paste
  • Next add tamarind paste, coriander leaves, red chili powder and fresh grated coconut make smooth paste if required add little amount of water
  • Serve it with any kind of dosa variety especially with Green gram Dosa/ Pesara Attu/ Moong Dal Dosa and idly
[gallery ids="458,459,460,461,462" type="square" columns="4"]

title: Green gram Dosa/ Pesara Attu/ Moong Dal Dosa
content:
Ingredients: Green gram/ Pesara Pappu/ Moong dal - 1 cup Ginger - 1 tb sp Green chillies - 5 Carrot grated - 1/2 cup Onion finely chopped - 1 cup Coriander - 2 tb sp Rice flour - 3 tb sp Salt - As per taste Oil -  3 tb sp Procedure:
  • Soak Green gram/ pesara pappu/ moong dal in a bowl for 8 hours
  • Add soaked green gram, green chillies,salt and chopped ginger in mixer grinder blend it till smooth paste. If required add some amount of water not much
  • Take out the batter to a bowl then add rice flour and mix it well
  • Batter should be medium thick consistency
  • Take a tawa, it should be in medium heat
  • Check the tawa is heat or not by sprinkling water on it
  • Now add one big laddle batter on center of the tawa and Spread the batter in circle shape
  • Now Spread chopped onion, grated carrot and coriander on top of the dosa and apply oil
  • Flip the dosa when it turns to golden brown and cook the other side also
  • Serve it in a plate with Spicy Ginger Chutney/ Allam pachadi
  • Enjoy the healthy dosa when it's hot
[caption id="attachment_507" align="alignnone" width="3000"] Dosa batter and oil[/caption]   [gallery ids="496,497,498,499" type="circle" columns="2"]
